control_variants.base_description: Establish and maintain a systematic approach to privacy notices that ensures all data processing activities are disclosed to data subjects in clear, accessible language. Implement processes for notice creation, review, approval, publication, and ongoing maintenance.

variants.description_additions: Use standardized privacy notice templates stored in shared document repository. Implement manual review process with designated privacy lead approving all notices before publication. Maintain simple spreadsheet tracking notice versions and publication dates.
evidence_requirements: Privacy notice template documents (PDF or Word format)
Review and approval records (email chains or checklist documents)
Notice inventory spreadsheet with publication dates
Sample published notices (screenshots or PDFs from website)

variants.description_additions: Implement notice registry in document management system with structured approval workflow. Maintain register of data subject audiences (customers, employees, job applicants, etc.) with tailored notices for each segment. Establish quarterly review cycle to verify notices remain current with processing activities.
evidence_requirements: Document management system export showing notice registry
Approval workflow logs demonstrating review and sign-off
Audience segmentation register with mapped notices
Version history showing notice updates and revisions
Quarterly review meeting minutes or completion reports

variants.description_additions: Deploy centralized content management system (CMS) integrated with Records of Processing Activities (ROPA). Implement automated review cycles with stakeholder notifications for privacy, legal, and business owners. Establish continuous monitoring to flag discrepancies between published notices and ROPA entries. Implement A/B testing for notice readability and comprehension.
evidence_requirements: CMS database export with full notice repository
ROPA-to-notice integration logs showing synchronization
Automated review cycle reports with stakeholder sign-offs
Discrepancy detection logs and remediation records
Readability test results and A/B testing analytics
Continuous monitoring dashboard screenshots

SE: Notices must be written in plain Swedish language appropriate for general public
Comply with Swedish Data Protection Authority (IMY) guidance on transparency and layered notices
Include specific reference to Swedish data subject rights under national implementation
FR: Provide layered notice format with summary and detailed views
Include specific CNIL-prescribed information elements for cookies and tracking
DE: Ensure notices meet German Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG) requirements
Include employee-specific notices complying with works council consultation requirements
Provide German-language notices for all German data subjects

control_variants.base_description: Establish comprehensive purpose limitation framework that documents processing purposes before data collection, prevents unauthorized secondary use, and ensures purpose compatibility assessments for any new processing activities. Integrate purpose documentation with data governance and access control mechanisms.

variants.description_additions: Document processing purposes in simplified Records of Processing Activities (ROPA) template. Establish approval process requiring privacy lead sign-off before any new data collection. Implement basic access controls restricting data use to documented purposes. Conduct manual purpose compatibility reviews before repurposing data.
evidence_requirements: ROPA document with documented purposes for each processing activity
New collection approval records (email or form submissions)
Access control policy defining purpose-based restrictions
Purpose compatibility assessment records for any secondary uses

variants.description_additions: Maintain structured ROPA in spreadsheet or dedicated tool with mandatory purpose field. Implement formal purpose compatibility assessment procedure using documented criteria. Establish technical controls (e.g., data access logging, purpose tags in databases) to enforce purpose boundaries. Train personnel quarterly on purpose limitation requirements and compatibility assessment procedures.
evidence_requirements: Structured ROPA with purpose documentation for all activities
Purpose compatibility assessment procedure document and completed assessments
Data access logs showing purpose-tagged queries or access requests
Purpose tagging in database schemas or data catalogs
Quarterly training records and materials
Technical control implementation evidence (access control configs, audit logs)

variants.description_additions: Deploy enterprise data governance platform with automated purpose enforcement. Integrate purpose metadata across data pipelines, warehouses, and analytics platforms. Implement real-time purpose compatibility engine that flags potential violations. Establish data governance council with quarterly purpose drift analysis. Deploy data lineage tracking to visualize purpose propagation across systems.
evidence_requirements: Data governance platform configuration with purpose taxonomy
Purpose metadata integration across data landscape (architecture diagrams)
Real-time purpose compatibility engine logs and alert records
Data governance council meeting minutes with purpose drift analysis
Data lineage diagrams showing purpose propagation
Automated policy enforcement reports
Purpose violation remediation tracking

SE: Comply with IMY guidance on purpose limitation interpretation
Document Swedish-specific legitimate interests assessments for purpose compatibility
FR: Follow CNIL methodology for purpose compatibility assessment
Maintain purpose compatibility register per CNIL recommendations

control_variants.base_description: Implement systematic data minimization framework including necessity assessments before collection, periodic data inventory reviews, and retention scheduling aligned with purpose requirements. Establish procedures to identify and eliminate unnecessary data holdings while maintaining adequate data for operational needs.

variants.description_additions: Conduct necessity review of data elements in collection forms (web forms, sign-up flows, etc.) before launch. Establish simple retention schedule based on purpose durations. Implement annual data clean-up procedures to delete data no longer needed. Document necessity rationale for each data field collected.
evidence_requirements: Data necessity assessment for each collection point (form reviews)
Retention schedule document with purpose-aligned durations
Annual data clean-up logs (deletion records)
Necessity rationale documentation for data fields

variants.description_additions: Establish data minimization review board meeting bi-annually to assess data holdings. Implement structured necessity assessment template for new data collection initiatives. Deploy automated retention rules in key systems (CRM, HR systems, databases). Conduct data mapping exercise identifying all personal data with necessity justification for each element. Train product and engineering teams on privacy by design and data minimization principles.
evidence_requirements: Data minimization review board meeting minutes and decisions
Completed necessity assessment templates for new initiatives
Automated retention rule configurations in systems
Data mapping documentation with necessity justifications
Privacy by design training records and materials
Deletion automation logs showing retention rule enforcement

variants.description_additions: Deploy enterprise-wide data minimization program with dedicated privacy engineering resources. Implement automated data discovery and classification tools to identify all personal data. Establish continuous data inventory monitoring with alerts for unnecessary data accumulation. Integrate necessity assessments into SDLC and data governance workflows. Deploy data retention automation across cloud and on-premise systems. Implement quarterly data minimization metrics reporting to executive leadership.
evidence_requirements: Data minimization program charter and resource allocation
Data discovery and classification tool reports
Continuous monitoring dashboard showing data accumulation trends
SDLC integration evidence (design review templates with minimization checks)
Data governance workflow configurations with necessity gates
Automated retention implementation across systems (configs and logs)
Quarterly executive metrics reports showing minimization KPIs
Privacy engineering capacity and project tracking

SE: Apply Swedish interpretation of adequacy and relevance standards
Document necessity assessments per IMY expectations
DE: Ensure data minimization approach complies with BDSG requirements
Include works council consultation for employee data minimization

control_variants.base_description: Establish systematic fairness assessment framework to evaluate processing operations from data subject perspective before implementation. Include impact assessments, safeguards against discriminatory or adverse outcomes, and mechanisms for addressing data subject concerns and complaints about fairness.

variants.description_additions: Conduct lightweight fairness review for new processing activities using simple checklist covering expected vs. unexpected use, discriminatory risk, and data subject expectations. Document legitimate interests and necessity rationale. Establish email-based mechanism for data subject concerns and complaints with designated response owner.
evidence_requirements: Fairness review checklist completed for each new processing activity
Legitimate interests assessment documentation
Data subject concern/complaint intake mechanism (email procedure)
Response records showing fairness concerns addressed

variants.description_additions: Implement structured fairness impact assessment process integrated into project approvals. Establish fairness review criteria including algorithmic fairness for automated decisions, transparency adequacy, and power imbalance consideration. Deploy formal data subject complaint handling procedure with SLA and escalation path. Conduct annual fairness audit of high-risk processing operations.
evidence_requirements: Fairness impact assessment procedure and completed assessments
Algorithmic fairness evaluation documentation for automated decisions
Complaint handling procedure with SLA documentation
Complaint intake logs and resolution records
Annual fairness audit reports for high-risk processing
Power imbalance analysis for vulnerable populations

variants.description_additions: Deploy enterprise fairness framework with dedicated ethical AI and fairness team. Integrate fairness-by-design principles into SDLC and data governance. Implement algorithmic auditing program with bias detection and mitigation procedures. Establish data subject advisory council for fairness oversight. Deploy automated fairness monitoring for high-risk processing with continuous metrics tracking. Conduct quarterly fairness assessments across all processing operations with executive reporting.
evidence_requirements: Enterprise fairness framework documentation and team charter
SDLC integration showing fairness checkpoints in development lifecycle
Algorithmic auditing program documentation and audit reports
Bias detection tool implementation and monitoring logs
Data subject advisory council meeting records and recommendations
Automated fairness monitoring dashboard and alert configurations
Quarterly executive fairness reports with metrics and trends
Fairness incident response and remediation tracking

SE: Apply Swedish interpretation of fairness principle under GDPR
Consider IMY guidance on fairness in automated decision-making
FR: Comply with CNIL requirements for algorithmic fairness and transparency
